Dear Sir:
tfe are requesting authorization from Appleton-Century-Crons publishing
Company to use a poem by V&ehel Undsay, "The Flower Fed Buffaloes", for
which we understand you hold the copyright.
Permission to use these materials is being sought by the N.A.E.B. in
connection with an arrangement we have with the Voice of America to
develop an English Ofcrough Poetry series. afce*13 commentaries for those
programs are being written by Professor M. L. Rosenthal of New York
University. She Voice of America, in turn, working closely with Professor
Rosenthal, will produce 13 quarter-hour radio scripts on the basis of
these commentaries. 33ie radio programs themselves are intended for
broadcast to listeners overseas, and are being designed to appeal to the
listeners interest in poetry in the English language.
In each script the poem will be read in its entirety, and the listeners
will also be invited to read the lines aloud in appropriate units after
the radio speaker.
Permission is sought both for the broadcast by the Voice of America to
overseas countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio
stations may receive the taped programs through the United States Information
Agency. Permission is also sought for publication of the poems that might
be published in any given country (with the aid or supervision of U.S.I.A.),
and distributed free or at cost to radio listeners. Permission is also
sought for eventual publication of the materials in a similar study booklet
to be produced by U.8.I.A. for gratis distribution to overseas listeners
who request such booklets.
Nb hope we will hear from you shortly and that authorization to use this
poem in the manner which we have outlined will be forthcoming, if you would
like to have additional information about the use to which these poems will
be put, may I suggest that you contact Dr. Robert Goodell, Chief, Radio
